sections.title: Section I
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: A natural unit, composed of living and non-living components, whose interactions result in a stable and self sustaining system is known as:
A herbicide is used to:
A community is:
selectableOptions: A group of populations of different species, living in the same habitat.
A group of populations of the same species, living in the same habitat.
The locality in which an organism is best adapted to live.
A group of populations in several habitats.
questions.wordAnswer: A group of populations of different species, living in the same habitat.

questions.question: An edaphic factor in an ecosystem:
In an ecosystem, green plants are referred to as:
Herbivores are examples of:
The ultimate source of energy in all living organisms is:

sections.title: Section II
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: Which of the following removes carbon dioxide from the atmosphere?
It is advisable to plant corn and beans on the same piece of land because:
selectableOptions: The beans will use the corn as support
The corn has root nodules, containing nitrogen fixing bacteria which adds nitrates to the soil
The beans has root nodules, containing nitrogen fixing bacteria which adds nitrates to the soil
The corn and beans will be harvested at the same time
questions.wordAnswer: The beans has root nodules, containing nitrogen fixing bacteria which adds nitrates to the soil

questions.question: In most ecosystems, the greatest amount of energy flows through the:
Which of the following causes eutrophication?
selectableOptions: Excess carbon dioxide in water body

questions.question: The number of individuals of a given species in a particular locality is known as:
A region with characteristic physical or climatic conditions which supports particular species of plants and animals is known as:
All of the following contributes to loss of soil fertility except:
Which of the following is an example of biological control?
selectableOptions: Active immunization of humans against Ebola
Infecting a specific pest species with a specific pathogen
Draining tropical swamp areas to destroy mosquito larvae
questions.wordAnswer: Infecting a specific pest species with a specific pathogen

questions.question: The recent increase in atmospheric carbon dioxide is mainly as a result of an increase in:
selectableOptions: The absorption of infrared radiation from the sun
The burning of fossil fuels and wood
questions.wordAnswer: The burning of fossil fuels and wood

questions.question: Which of the following is not recycled in a ecosystem?
Excess amount of sulphur dioxide in the atmosphere can lead to rain which has:
If untreated sewage is dumped into a river, the oxygen content drops because:
Nitrogen fixing bacteria:
selectableOptions: Convert ammonia into nitrites and nitrates
Convert atmospheric nitrogen into soil nitrites and nitrates
questions.wordAnswer: Convert atmospheric nitrogen into soil nitrites and nitrates

sections.title: Section III
sections.directions:
Each question consists of three responses. 
One or more of the response(s) is or are correct. 
Select: 
A. If 1, 2 and 3 are all correct. 
B. If 1 and 2 only are correct. 
C. If 2 and 3 only are correct. 
D. If 1 only is correct.

questions.question: Plant adaptation to reduce water loss include:
In the flow of energy from a lower to a higher trophic level:
nonSelectableOptions: Energy flows in a linear manner

questions.question: Food chains and food webs are similar in that:
nonSelectableOptions: Both involves the transfer of energy
Both involves the transfer of matter
Both contain green plants as the primary consumer

questions.question: Which of the following reduce(s) soil fertility?
Example of water pollutants include:

sections.title: Section IV
sections.directions:
Each question consists of a First and Second statements. 
Choose: 
A. If both statements are true and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first. 
B. If both statements are true and the second statement is not a correct explanation of the first. 
C. If the first statement is true and the second statement is false. 
D. If the first statement is false and the second statement is true.

twoStatements: Xerophytes are plants adapted to live in conditions of prolonged drought
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is False. Second statement is True

twoStatements: Planting of trees help to reduce the atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Tropical soils tend to be poor in nitrate.
The higher the temperature, the more active denitrifying bacteria become
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Energy flows in a linear manner in a food chain
The amount of energy reduces as it flows through a food chain
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: A food web is a more complex feeding relationship than a food chain
In a food web, each organism has only one food source
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is True. Second statement is False

sections.title: Section V
sections.directions:
Each question consists of four lettered headings A, B, C and D. 
Select the heading which is closely related to the description.

questions.question: The washing down of mineral salts from top soil
Rapid growth of aquatic plants and algae due to deposition of inorganic fertilizers from farmlands:
The use of cat to control rat population
A group of similar organisms, which are able to breed together to produce fertile offsprings
Plants which grow on a tree branch, relying on the tree for support only:
Heterotrophic organisms feeding on dead and decaying matter by secreting digestive enzymes extracellularly:
An animal that captures, kills and eats another animal:
The use of herbicides to kill specific plants:
An association between two organisms in which one gains while the other neither gains nor loses
The locality in which an organism is best adapted to live:

sections.title: Section VI
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: Which of the following does not release carbon dioxide into the atmosphere?
It converts nitrites to nitrates
Which of the following activities increases the nitrogen content of the soil?
The association between leguminous plants and nitrogen fixing bacteria is known as:
Food chains with more than five links are rare because:
selectableOptions: The size of organisms increase from lower to higher trophic level in a food chain
Energy reduces from lower to higher trophic level in a food chain
Energy increases from lower to higher trophic level in a food chain
questions.wordAnswer: Energy reduces from lower to higher trophic level in a food chain

questions.question: Which of the following gases could be of value to growing plants when introduced into the air of a greenhouse?
Land use for agriculture and urbanization by humans causes:
selectableOptions: Disturbance in the balance in atmospheric oxygen and carbon dioxide
questions.wordAnswer: Disturbance in the balance in atmospheric oxygen and carbon dioxide

questions.question: It is a consequence of global warming:
What is the role of decomposers in an ecosystem?
selectableOptions: Ensure conversion of light energy to chemical energy

questions.question: An oil spill will affect an aquatic ecosystem by:
selectableOptions: Increasing carbon dioxide released by producers
Reducing amount of light reaching the producers
Increasing carbon dioxide absorption by producers
questions.wordAnswer: Reducing amount of light reaching the producers
